column2: Position: Chemist Shift Incharge Department: Manufacturing/Chemical Production Location: Tuticorin  Reporting to: Production Manager/Plant Manager Job Summary: We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Chemist Shift Incharge to oversee and manage the chemical production processes during assigned shifts. This entry-level position is ideal for recent graduates in chemistry or related fields who are looking to start their careers in a dynamic and challenging manufacturing environment. The successful candidate will ensure that production activities are carried out efficiently, safely, and in compliance with quality standards. Key Responsibilities: Shift Supervision:  Oversee chemical production operations during the assigned shift, ensuring that all activities are performed according to standard operating procedures (SOPs) and safety guidelines. Quality Control:  Conduct routine quality control tests on raw materials, in-process samples, and finished products to ensure compliance with specifications and standards. Process Monitoring:  Monitor production processes and equipment to ensure they are operating correctly and efficiently. Identify and troubleshoot any issues or deviations in the production process. Documentation:  Maintain accurate and detailed records of production activities, including batch records, test results, and equipment logs. Safety Compliance:  Ensure that all safety protocols are strictly followed by the team. Conduct regular safety inspections and participate in safety training sessions. Team Coordination:  Coordinate with other shift in charges, production staff, and maintenance teams to ensure smooth and continuous operations. Provide guidance and support to junior team members. Inventory Management:  Monitor and manage inventory levels of raw materials, chemicals, and consumables. Coordinate with the procurement team to ensure timely replenishment of stock. Reporting:  Prepare and submit shift reports detailing production outputs, quality control results, equipment status, and any incidents or issues encountered during the shift. Continuous Improvement:  Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to optimize production processes, reduce waste, and enhance product quality. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related field. Experience:  Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply. Any prior internship or industrial training experience in a chemical manufacturing environment will be an advantage. Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment. Basic understanding of chemical safety and handling procedures. Proficiency in using basic laboratory equipment and software (e.g., MS Office). Working Conditions: The role involves working in a chemical manufacturing plant, which may require wearing personal protective equipment (PPE). Shift work, including nights, weekends, and holidays, may be required. How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter outlining their qualifications and interest in the position to vishnupriya.a@cielhr.com / 99438 28030.
column11: Training, Quality control, Quality Check, Shift supervision, Supervision
